Title: Minor offences come back to haunt Indian students in US, told to self-deport
Description: US authorities are now revoking visas of Indian students for minor offenses, including traffic violations, after previously targeting them for alleged campus activism. Dozens have received notices from their schools, citing past incidents like lane shifting, drunk driving, and shoplifting as reasons for immediate departure.

Title: Students miss JEE exam, claim deputy CM Pawan Kalyan's convoy caused jam
Description: Visakhapatnam students claim they missed their JEE (Main) session 2 exam due to traffic disruptions caused by Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan's convoy. They are requesting a special exam from the NTA, alleging that security measures for the convoy led to significant delays. However, police refute these claims, stating that traffic wasn't stopped and absentee numbers were lower than usual.

Title: 'Fake doctor' accused of killing 7 through botched surgeries arrested
Description: Police in Damoh, MP, have detained N John Camm, also known as Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, from Prayagraj, UP. He's accused of unauthorized surgeries at Damoh's Mission Hospital, allegedly causing seven patient deaths. Hired for ₹8 lakh monthly, Camm operated on 13 patients. Authorities are investigating discrepancies in his credentials, including an invalid Andhra Pradesh Medical Council registration.

Title: 'Concussed' career: Aus cricketer, 27, retires after 1 Test
Description: Australian cricketer Will Pucovski, aged 27, has retired due to persistent concussion symptoms. He last played in March 2024, suffering a head injury. Pucovski, who played one Test match in 2021, revealed ongoing issues like fatigue, headaches, and motion sickness.

Title: American company sacks 700 employees, including 200 in Telugu ‘donation scam'
Description: Fannie Mae laid off 700 employees, with about 200 terminations, primarily of Telugu origin, due to ethical violations related to the misuse of the 'matching grants program'. Employees allegedly colluded with non-profits like TANA, mirroring a similar scam at Apple where employees were fired for exploiting the company's charitable donation matching program.

Title: IPL: Bumrah returns, but Krunal delivers
Description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru edged out Mumbai Indians by 12 runs in a thrilling IPL match at Wankhede Stadium. After RCB posted 221/5, MI's Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya threatened with a blistering partnership, but crucial wickets in the death overs sealed the win for RCB.

Title: 2 dead, 8 injured as 'drunk' driver goes on rampage in Jaipur
Description: In a tragic incident in Jaipur's Nahargarh area, a drunk driver in an SUV rammed into pedestrians and vehicles, resulting in the deaths of two individuals, Avdesh Pareek and Mamta, and injuries to at least eight others. The out-of-control vehicle also struck people and cars on MI Road and Galta Gate, causing chaos and attracting a large crowd.

Title: Trump’s tariff shock unleashes the unknown! But is there a silver lining?
Description: Donald Trump's tariffs have triggered global market turmoil, with Asian markets plummeting and Indian markets experiencing significant losses. Investors are selling shares of companies with US exposure, and foreign investors are pulling out funds. Experts warn of a potential global recession and stagflation, though some remain optimistic about India's long-term growth.

Title: Wife of Rippling's co-founder accuses him of forcing open marriage ...
Description: Dhivya Sashidhar has leveled serious allegations of coercion, abuse, and tax evasion against her estranged husband, Rippling co-founder Prasanna Sankar. Sankar, in turn, has accused Sashidhar of infidelity and making false accusations. The couple is currently engaged in a legal custody battle over their nine-year-old son.

Title: 'Cops planted evidence': SC acquits death row convict after a decade
Description: The Supreme Court acquitted a man after a decade on death row in a rape-murder case, citing a flawed police investigation with planted evidence and an unfair trial. The bench criticized the Uttarakhand police for fabricating evidence and the trial court for its biased proceedings.

Title: Top stocks to sell today: Stock market recommendations for April 8
Description: Stock market sell recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests selling IRB Infra and Paytm. IRB Infra broke a flag pattern, indicating a downtrend towards Rs 38, with resistance at Rs 43.60 and Rs 45. Similarly, Paytm broke a rising wedge pattern, expected to decline to Rs 720, facing resistance at Rs 804 and Rs 822.

Title: ‘Incredible real estate’: Trump revives Gaza plan during talks with Netanyahu
Description: Donald Trump proposed US control over Gaza, envisioning its transformation into a thriving hub and suggesting the relocation of its residents. While Netanyahu acknowledged the need for a new approach, Arab nations rejected the resettlement plan. Leaders from France, Jordan, and Egypt advocated for Palestinian Authority control, a proposal Israel previously dismissed.

Title: How Apple 'flew' 5 flights with iPhones from India & China to beat Trump Tariffs
Description: Anticipating new tariffs imposed by the US, Apple expedited shipments of iPhones and other products from India to the US in late March. This strategic move aimed to avoid a 10% reciprocal tariff, allowing Apple to maintain current pricing temporarily.

Title: Trump's tariffs: Larger the US business, bigger the stock hit
Description: Indian stocks with significant US market exposure are facing heavy selling pressure amid growing recession fears in the US and a potential global slowdown. Concerns over high US import tariffs and retaliatory measures are impacting sectors like auto, metals, software, and pharma.

Title: What did Ayushmann do when he first heard about his wife Tahira's breast cancer?
Description: Tahira Kashyap, filmmaker and wife of Ayushmann Khurrana, has announced a relapse of her cancer, years after her initial diagnosis and mastectomy in 2019. Ayushmann has shown support for her resilience. He previously recounted hiding in the hospital when they first learned of her breast cancer, emphasizing Tahira's strength and inspiring presence throughout her journey.

Title: Jalandhar: Blast reported outside BJP leader's house
Description: Around 1 a.m., an explosion occurred outside BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's Jalandhar residence. Kalia, initially thinking it was thunder, notified the police after being informed of the blast. Forensic teams are currently inspecting the site, and CCTV footage is being reviewed to determine the cause and identify any potential suspects.

Title: Gujaratis step into space long shaped by Punjabis in Canadian politics
Description: As Canada gears up for its 45th federal election, a notable shift is occurring within the Indian diaspora. While Punjabi-Canadians have long dominated South Asian political engagement, this election sees a surge of Gujarati-origin candidates entering the political arena.

Title: 'Sikandar' box office collection: Salman starrer sees decline on second Monday
Description: After finally crossing Rs 100 crore, the Salman Khan film sees a huge drop in the numbers on day 9 which is second Monday. The film ended up making only Rs 1.75 crore on Monday. Here's the total collection so far!

Title: Becoming HC judge is tougher now: Less than 50% make it
Description: The Supreme Court collegium, led by CJI Sanjiv Khanna, has tightened the selection process for High Court judges, resulting in a significant drop in the success rate of recommended lawyers. Previously, nearly 90% of HC collegia recommendations were approved, but now less than 50% pass muster after mandatory interviews.

Title: After tulip stroll with Rijiju, Waqf thorns sprout for Omar Abdullah
Description: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's morning walk with Union Minister Kiran Rijiju sparked opposition uproar in the assembly. This occurred after the rejection of a motion to discuss the Waqf law, which Rijiju piloted in Parliament.

Title: 26/11: US SC rejects Rana plea for stay on extradition
Description: The US Supreme Court has rejected Tahawwur Rana's plea to halt his extradition to India, where he faces charges related to the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks. Rana, a Canadian national, is accused of aiding the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terror group. He previously served a 14-year sentence for supporting a plot to attack a Danish newspaper and aiding LeT.

Title: Govt puts time riders to receipt, utilisation of funds under FCRA
Description: The Indian government has imposed a three-year limit for NGOs to receive foreign funds under the FCRA after prior permission is granted, with a four-year timeframe for utilizing these funds. The home ministry warned of punitive action for violations, but allows for extensions based on the merits of individual cases. This new rule is effective from April 7, 2025.

Title: Taylor recalls feeling used 'like a prized calf' in fallout with former label boss
Description: Taylor Swift's relationship with Scott Borchetta of Big Machine Records soured after he sold her masters to Scooter Braun without her consent. Swift felt betrayed, comparing herself to a "prized calf" being sold off. Allegedly, Borchetta and Braun spread misinformation about her. Determined to regain control, Swift is re-recording her early albums, reclaiming her music and narrative from powerful men.

Title: Didi: Ready to go to jail to ensure eligible teachers don't lose jobs
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee pledged to regularize the jobs of eligible teaching and non-teaching staff affected by the Supreme Court's verdict on the SSC recruitment scam, even risking jail. She assured them of alternative plans to avoid service breaks and promised to complete the process within two months.

Title: BJD MP blames Pandian for Waqf flip-flop; Naveen promises probe
Description: Internal conflict within the BJD has escalated following the party's controversial vote on the Waqf Bill. Rajya Sabha member Debashish Samantaray openly blamed former bureaucrat V K Pandian for the voting fiasco, leading to strong criticism from his party colleagues.

Title: MAGA billionaires balk at Donald Trump's tariff gambit, warn of 'economic nuclear winter'
Trump admin wins court approval to fast-track deportations under wartime law
Description: The US Supreme Court has granted the Trump administration temporary authority to deport Venezuelan migrants accused of gang ties under the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. While allowing fast-track deportations, the court mandated that affected individuals receive a court hearing to contest their removal. The ruling exposed divisions within the court, with dissenting justices raising concerns about bypassing judicial scrutiny.

Title: Trump's tariffs trigger meltdown: The Lal Street bleeds in reciprocal rampage
Description: Global stock markets plummeted following Donald Trump's tariff announcements, sparking recession fears. Dalal Street mirrored this downturn, with Sensex and Nifty falling sharply, eroding investor wealth significantly. Foreign funds led the sell-off, though domestic investors provided some support. Experts suggest India's strong domestic economy might offer some insulation from the global turmoil, with potential rate cuts on the horizon.

Title: Govt raises LPG price for all categories; special excise duty on petrol, diesel
Description: The government has increased LPG prices for all categories, including Ujjwala beneficiaries, and raised the special additional excise duty on petrol and diesel by Rs 2 per litre.

Title: SC plays by 'no mention' rule, no urgent Waqf pleas listing
Description: Several Muslim organizations, including DMK, Jamiat Ulama-e-Hind, AIMPLB, and Samastha Kerala Jamiathul Ulema, have challenged the constitutional validity of the Waqf (Amendment) Act in the Supreme Court. The petitions primarily object to the elimination of the 'waqf by user' provision and allege the "ouster of Muslims" from waqf management, claiming violations of fundamental rights and religious freedom.

Title: Pannun plot: Indian national Nikhil Gupta's trial to begin in Nov
Description: Nikhil Gupta, an Indian national accused of plotting to assassinate Sikh separatist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, will face trial in New York on November 3. The trial, initially expected to last two weeks, has been limited to one week by the US district judge.

Title: Rule of law appears to have completely broken down in UP, says SC
Description: The Supreme Court expressed strong disapproval of the Uttar Pradesh police for routinely filing FIRs in civil disputes, highlighting a breakdown of the rule of law. The court directed the state's Director General of Police to submit an affidavit and summoned an investigating officer to explain the misuse of criminal law in a money dispute case from Noida.

Title: 'Resetting the table': Trump says he won’t pause tariffs as markets reel
Description: Amidst market turmoil, US President Donald Trump remains firm on his tariff policy, dismissing concerns from economists and market anxieties. He threatened China with increased tariffs if it doesn't reverse its trade practices by April 8th, 2025. Financial markets reacted sharply, with the S&P 500 briefly entering bear market territory.

Title: Trump turns up the heat on China in hostile trade war
Description: President Trump escalated trade tensions with China, threatening additional tariffs if Beijing doesn't retract its retaliatory measures. He also declared an end to talks with China until the trade deficit is addressed, while demanding reparations from Europe. The US stock market experienced volatility, and Trump urged Americans to remain strong amidst the economic uncertainty.

Title: Rape-murder: SC acquits man sent to gallows by trial court
Description: In 2009, a Dalit girl's tragic death led to a conviction for rape and murder, later overturned by the Supreme Court in 2024. The SC cited inadequate legal assistance during the trial, raising questions about judicial training and police investigation.

Title: E-surveillance will boost border security: Shah in J&K
Description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced the deployment of advanced electronic surveillance systems and technological initiatives to bolster border security during his visit to Jammu and Kashmir. These measures include tunnel detection and anti-drone technology. Shah also met with families of slain policemen, offering support and recognizing the BSF's crucial role as the first line of defense.

Title: 'Military space doctrine' in 2-3 months: CDS Anil Chauhan amid China push
Description: India is developing a military space doctrine expected within months, according to Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan. This initiative responds to China's growing space warfare capabilities and aims to establish a robust "space culture" within India. The doctrine will guide the Defence Space Agency and inform a national military space policy, fostering innovation and strategic capabilities.

Title: 1 killed, 8 hurt as ‘drunk’ film director crashes SUV in Kolkata
Description: In Kolkata's Thakurpukur, director Siddhant Das, allegedly intoxicated, drove his SUV into a crowded market, resulting in the death of a vegetable vendor and critically injuring eight others. Enraged locals vandalized the vehicle and assaulted Das before police intervened and arrested him.

Title: IPL: Krunal 4-for floors brother Hardik Pandya's Mumbai Indians
Description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Mumbai Indians by 12 runs in IPL 2025. Krunal Pandya's brilliant bowling performance was the game changer. He took 4 wickets, including that of his brother Hardik. Rajat Patidar and Virat Kohli scored 64 and 67 respectively for RCB. Hardik and Tilak Varma fought hard for MI.

Title: Trump warns Iran of 'great danger' if nuclear deal collapses
Description: Donald Trump has issued a stern warning to Iran, hinting at potential military action if diplomatic efforts to curb its nuclear ambitions fail. Direct talks are scheduled, but Iran's Supreme Leader remains opposed. Tensions escalate as Iran enriches uranium, nearing weapons-grade levels.

Title: 'Dirty game': Mamata tries to woo sacked teachers as BJP piles pressure
Description: West Bengal's political arena is ablaze once more as BJP and TMC clash over the school jobs case, impacting 25,753 teachers. The Calcutta High Court's annulment of appointments due to fraud has triggered a blame game, with BJP demanding Mamata Banerjee's resignation and accusing her nephew of corruption.

Title: $9.5tn and counting: How Trump's 'Chart of Death' has upended world markets
Description: Global financial markets experienced a significant downturn, erasing trillions in equity value due to President Trump's tariffs. Major indices entered bear market territory, with stocks, commodities, and crypto plummeting as investors sought safety in Treasuries and the yen. Recession fears are escalating, prompting market volatility and concerns about the Federal Reserve's response.

Title: Bomb threat note found in IndiGo toilet: Aircraft makes emergency landing
Description: An IndiGo flight 6E 5324, carrying 225 passengers from Jaipur to Mumbai, made an emergency landing at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport around 8:50 pm on April 7 following a bomb threat. A note indicating a bomb threat was discovered in one of the aircraft's lavatories.

Title: IPL: After Chepauk, RCB end another long-term drought at Wankhede
Description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru ended their decade-long losing streak at Wankhede Stadium, defeating Mumbai Indians by 12 runs in a thrilling IPL match. Bengaluru posted a strong 221-5, propelled by Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar, and Jitesh Sharma. Despite a valiant effort from Hardik Pandya and Tilak Varma, Mumbai fell short, losing key wickets in the final overs.

Title: Russia 'monitoring situation closely' as oil prices fall after Trump's tariff
Description: The global oil market is facing turbulence following the US's implementation of new tariffs on numerous countries, impacting Russia's budget. Brent crude oil futures have plummeted to their lowest level since April 2021. Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov expressed concern over the market volatility and assured that Russia is taking measures to safeguard its economy.

Title: 'Unacceptable': UK slams Israel over detention of British MPs
Description: British Minister Hamish Falconer strongly condemned Israel's denial of entry to two British MPs, Yuan Yang and Abtisam Mohamed, despite prior clearance. Detained for six hours upon arrival, they were later flown back to the UK. Falconer highlighted this unprecedented action against democratically elected officials from a partner nation.

Title: Wankhede roars! Noise hits 138 dB as Kohli gets Dhoni-like welcome
Description: Virat Kohli was greeted with an overwhelming reception at Wankhede Stadium during the RCB-MI clash in IPL 2025, as the crowd's roar reached a record-breaking 138 decibels. Echoing the frenzy usually reserved for MS Dhoni, Kohli responded with a brilliant innings of 67 runs. He also became the first Indian to surpass 13,000 T20 runs, solidifying his legendary status.

Title: Heatwaves drove 1/3rd of rise in India's power demand during 2024 summer: Report
Description: During the peak heatwave months from April to June, the demand was 10.8% higher than the previous year

Title: A case for a fair seat allocation
Description: Article 1 of the Constitution proclaims that India shall be a Union of States. The term Union implies that the arrangement or rearrangement of the component units should be on the basis of equity. There are serious apprehensions in the south on the question of readjustment of seats in the Lok Sabha

Title: Children undergoing cancer treatment in Mumbai and Chennai get chess coaching classes
Description: For children undergoing cancer treatment, chess can help prevent potential cognitive decline and promote emotional resilience during their cancer treatment.

Title: Jalgaon authorities cancel 43 forged birth and death document orders
Description: On February 21, 2025, a person suddenly submitted a total of 50 birth and death document orders of the Tehsildar to the Birth and Death Department of the Municipal Corporation but when it was scrutinised, it was found that the signature on the order was forged.

Title: Pune woman’s death: probe panel finds hospital guilty of denying immediate treatment
Description: A state-appointed probe committee has found Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital in Pune in violation of emergency care norms after it allegedly denied admission to a pregnant woman, Tanisha Bhise, said the hospital failed to comply with the Bombay Public Trust Act

Title: Morning Digest: MEA Jaishankar, U.S. Secretary of State Rubio pitch for early conclusion of the Bilateral Trade Agreement; Trump urges Netanyahu to end Gaza war, and more
Description: Here is a select list of stories to start your day.

Title: Farmers leave tomatoes in fields as price drops to ₹2 a kg
Description: The farmers said the selling price of one box (15 kg) of tomatoes is anywhere between ₹30 to ₹200 (₹2 per kg to ₹13 per kg) at the Kolar Agricultural Produce Market Committee

Title: Kashmir’s lesser-known spring blooms
Description: For centuries, ethnic communities have used these endemic blooms for medicinal and cultural purposes

Description: Subsequent searches led to the seizure of about ₹63.85 lakh in cash, gold bars and ornaments worth close to ₹3.46 crore.

Description: Protests by BJP leaders also led to the arrests of multiple protesters including senior leader Locket Chatterjee

Description: Caste is increasingly becoming crucial to people’s identity and the State’s politics

Description: SCR achieved the milestone backed by excellent performance in both freight and passenger segments

Obesity to anxiety, report flags rising tide of lifestyle diseases in Telangana
Description: Apollo Hospitals’ HoN-2025 report reveals alarming trends in lifestyle diseases, urging immediate action to combat rising health risks

Title: Intermediate education needs corrective interventions, says  Telangana gazetted junior lecturers’ association
Description: As of 2025, the State has 424 government junior colleges for both general and vocational streams and nearly 1.43 lakh students

Title: Telangana poised to emerge as hub for highly skilled HR: Minister Sridhar Babu
Description: The government is committed to equipping the youth of Telangana with top-tier skills to align with the evolving needs of various industries, Mr.Sridhar Babu said

Title: ‘Turned away’ by two private hospital in Gurugram, techie dies of accident injuries
Description: Shomita Singh a 28-year-old software engineer and part of a women riders’ group, was hit by a sedan coming from the front in Badshahpur on Sunday

Kishan Reddy deletes AI generated image post
MoU signed between the Supreme Courts of India and Nepal
Description: This MoU aims to create formal mechanisms for judicial exchanges, joint research, training programmes, seminars, and visits

Title: Man who allegedly posed as doctor, performed heart surgeries held
Description: The matter came to light on April 5 after the Damoh Child Welfare Committee said a probe was underway by a district-level committee against a man who impersonated as a doctor using forged documents and performed surgeries on heart patients at Mission Hospital

Description: The ruling National Conference terms the removal of Nazir Khan as DDC Chairperson a ‘powerful assertion of democratic will at the grassroots level’

IIT-Madras develops wearable indoor mapping technology
Description: UbiqMap uses radio frequency imaging and will empower first responders in rescue operations

Description: The AICC session is being held in Gujarat after 64 years with the last one held at Bhavnagar in 1961

NGT directs TNPCB to act on untreated sewage discharge into Gulf of Mannar
Description: While hearing a suo motu case on the issue of pollution off the Ramanathapuram coast, Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana referred to Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board’s report that said the Keelakarai municipality generates 3.25 mld of sewage

State Cabinet Sub-committee to discuss drinking water crisis in next week meeting

Mahatma Gandhi had recognised rights of Palestinians to their land: Palestinian envoy

60% of lands under Hill Area Conservation Authority likely to be released, says Minister
Entire Pakistan border to be covered with electronic surveillance system in four years: Amit Shah
Description: During an interaction with BSF personnel at an outpost in Kathua, the Union Home Minister says after the installation of the technology, soldiers will find it much easier to receive information and respond immediately to any actions by the enemy. He also met the families of policeman killed by terrorists.

Title: Lahar Singh urges Karnataka govt. not to succumb to pressure to lift ban on Bandipur night traffic
15 AIADMK MLAs evicted from Assembly for displaying placards without Speaker’s permission
Description: As 14 out of the 15 AIADMK MLAs evicted on Monday were sent out for the second time during the ongoing session, Speaker M. Appavu initially said they could not take part in the rest of the session. The Speaker eventually reduced the suspension period to a day following a request made by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin

Title: As Amit Shah arrives in Kashmir, three more separatists quit Hurriyat, pledge allegiance to Constitution
Description: There has been a series of such public renunciation of separatism by separatist leaders in the past one month in Kashmir. It’s for the first time since militancy broke out in 1990 that separatists issued such statements.

Title: A ‘EEE Project’ solution for the University of Hyderabad land including international education corridor and eco-park
Description: The aim is to elevate Hyderabad’s status as a global education destination, environmentally sensitive and employment-oriented

Title: HDK hits out at Cheluvarayaswamy, calls him as ‘joker’
U.S. Supreme Court denies Tahawwur Rana’s application seeking stay on extradition to India
Description: Rana, 64, a Canadian national of Pakistani origin, is currently lodged in the Metropolitan Detention Center in Los Angeles

Title: Pilot rest and duty norms: Delhi HC disposes of matter after DGCA undertaking on July 1 timeline
Description: In its order on February 24, 2025, the court ruled that the weekly rest for pilots will be raised from 36 hours to 48 hours from July 1 as part of phase-wise implementation of DGCA’s revised norms for pilots

Title: RGUHS implements current evaluation system even for repeaters
Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu lauds Andhra Pradesh’s economic growth
Description: State seet to achieve a GSDP growth rate of 16.28% by 2028-29 Financial Year, says the Chief Minister

Title: Home births a blot on Kerala’s efforts to keep maternal, infant mortality at bay
Description: State’s efforts to maintain its track record in advancing maternal and neonatal health being undermined by a small proportion which opts for home births, without any regard for the possible long-term impact on the health of the mothers and newborn babies

Title: Best Doctor Awards given away on World Health Day
Description: Minister inaugurates facilitation of digital payments for various services in government hospitals. In the first phase, 313 hospitals are being equipped

Title: A.P. unveils holistic healthcare vision: CM Chandrababu Naidu advocates lifestyle reform for a healthier State
Description: Disclosing a survey report that identified 10 diseases that accounted for more than 80% of the disease burden in Andhra Pradesh, CM advises regular exercise, diet and lifestyle changes to combat chronic ailments; Eluru, NTR and Krishna districts report the highest cases of dual incidence of hypertension and diabetes

Title: Fancy number ‘0007’ fetches ₹45.99 lakh in Ernakulam RTO auction
Description: The kerala government has notified six categories of fancy numbers with base prices ranging from ₹3,000 to ₹1 lakh. One (1) remains the most fancied number with a base price tag of ₹1 lakh.

Title: Mongolia-tagged fishing eagle keeps visiting Kaziranga to breed since 2020
Description: The male Pallas’s fish eagle uses the Central Asian Flyway, one of the nine global waterbird migration routes, to travel between the rhino domain in Assam and Buuntsagaan Lake in Mongolia

Description: The probe is based on a prosecution complaint filed by the Haryana State Pollution Control Board under the Environment Protection Act, against Goverdhan Mines and Minerals and others

Title: FIR to be registered against teachers who use children to clean toilets in schools: DSEL
Description: Department of School Education and Literacy has taken strong objection to teachers violating instructions issued to all government schools regarding the practice
